metadata.title: CVE-2016-9014 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Django before 1.8.x before 1.8.16, 1.9.x before 1.9.11, and 1.10.x before1.10.3, when settings.DEBUG is True, allow remote attackers to conduct DNSrebinding attacks by leveraging failure to validate the HTTP Host headeragainst settings.ALLOWED_HOSTS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4
python-django-common - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4
python3-django - 1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.7-1ubuntu5.4').
